tool.name: BISG

param.name: customerLayer
param.dialogReference: The input customer table or layer. This tool does not use spatial functions to generate probabilities so a geocoded customer layer is not necessary.

param.name: customerID
param.dialogReference: The field describing a unique identifier in the customer layer.

param.name: surname
param.dialogReference: The field describing the surname of each customer in the table or layer.

param.name: tract
param.dialogReference: The field describing the FIPS value of of each customer in the table or layer. If this field does not exist, it can be created using the "Enrich Customer Portfolio with FFIEC Data" tool in this toolbox.

param.name: mode
param.expression: Append to Input Layer | Create New Layer
param.dialogReference:
The probablities will be created and added to the customer layer. There are two modes for doing this.

  • Append to Input Layer - with this setting, the input layer will be modified by adding and calculating the new fields to it.

  • Create New Layer - the input layer will be copied to a new layer and the new fields will be added and calculated to it, thus preserving the original file.

param.name: outFC
param.dialogReference: This parameter is only available if "Create New Layer" is selected as the output mode. Specify the location and name of the feature class to be created.

tool.summary: Uses Surgeo's BISG algorithm to append race/ethnicity probability fields to an input customer layer.
tool.usage: Use this tool to add race/ethnicity probability fields to a customer layer. This tool leverages the BISG algorithm in the Surgeo python library to take surname and census tract FIPS codes to generate these probabilities.
